DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the present study is to compare the response to cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) in patients with chronic advanced heart failure and permanent atrial fibrillation (AF) depending on atrio ventricular junction (AVJ) is ablated or not.
DOC.brief_title: Spanish Atrial Fibrillation And Resynchronization Study
DOC.detailed_description: Cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT) improves the functional capacity and the quality of life and reduces the mortality of patients with dilated cardiomyopathy, low ejection fraction and wide QRS. Only 2% of patients included in CRT randomized trials were in AF. To obtain a good response to CRT, percentage >90% of ventricular pacing must be obtained. Based on observational studies, current guidelines of CRT recommend the atrio ventricular junction (AVJ) ablation in those patients with permanent atrial fibrillation.
DOC.criteria: Dilated cardiomyopathy (LVEDD >56 mm) wide QRS (> 120 msec) NYHA IIIIV EF<35% Permanent AF
